article.headline: VMI 87, High Point 74
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. -- D.J. Covington scored 20 points and four other Virginia Military Institute players scored in double figures as the Keydets beat High Point 87-74 Thursday night. The Keydets (13-11, 6-8 Big South Conference) snapped a three-game skid and beat High Point for the sixth straight time. Ron Burks added 17 points, Stan Okoye had 14 while Austin Kenon and Keith Gabriel each contributed 11. The Panthers (10-14, 6-8) had won four in a row, but were outrebounded 47-30 and outscored 40-18 in the paint. Nick Barbour's 25 points and Shay Shine's 22 led High Point, but their teammates made only 10 of 34 shots from the field and none scored in double figures. Kenon made 4 of 6 free throws, but the misses were his first since Jan. 15. His layup with 5:40 left equaled the Keydets' biggest lead, 79-59. The Panthers responded with 10 straight points, but came no closer than nine points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
